meanings.definition: Apply or bring to bear (a force, influence, or quality)
meanings.sent1: She was exerting all her strength to open the stubborn jar.
meanings.sent2: He exerted his authority to maintain order in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The little ant was exerting its tiny muscles to carry the heavy crumb.
meanings.sent4: The sun exerted its scorching heat on the desert below.
meanings.sent5: The determined climber was exerting every ounce of energy to reach the mountain peak.

meanings.definition: Make a physical or mental effort
meanings.sent1: After exerting himself at the gym, he felt accomplished.
meanings.sent2: She exerted her mind to solve the challenging puzzle.
meanings.sent3: The cat was exerting its curiosity by pawing at the mysterious object.
meanings.sent4: The student exerted great focus during the exam.
meanings.sent5: The team was exerting maximum effort to win the championship.
